classes.title: EXSS50
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Discrimination and Sport.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will examine the American ethos by looking at those who have been discriminated against in sport because of race, gender, sexual orientation, or disability.Gen Ed: SS, US.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS51
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Entrepreneurship in Human Performance and Sport.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will examine the American ethos by looking at those who have been discriminated against in sport because of race, gender, sexual orientation, or disability.Gen Ed: SS, US.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS51
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Entrepreneurship in Human Performance and Sport.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will provide students an introduction to the practical entrepreneurial business tools for starting a new business (or for use in an existing organization) in the human performance and/or sport industry.Gen Ed: EE- Field Work.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS89
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Special Topics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will provide students an introduction to the practical entrepreneurial business tools for starting a new business (or for use in an existing organization) in the human performance and/or sport industry.Gen Ed: EE- Field Work.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS89
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Special Topics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course content will vary each semester.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS141
classes.subtitle: Personal Health.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course content will vary each semester.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS141
classes.subtitle: Personal Health.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Elective, open to all students. This course examines basic wellness concepts in the areas of physical fitness, nutrition, disease prevention, mental health, drug abuse, and human sexuality. Emphasis is on the individual's responsibility for his/her own health.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS175
classes.subtitle: Human Anatomy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Elective, open to all students. This course examines basic wellness concepts in the areas of physical fitness, nutrition, disease prevention, mental health, drug abuse, and human sexuality. Emphasis is on the individual's responsibility for his/her own health.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS175
classes.subtitle: Human Anatomy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The study of the structure of the human body with special emphasis on the musculoskeletal, articular, and nervous systems. Prosected cadaver materials are utilized to study the skeletal muscles and body viscera.Gen Ed: PL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS180
classes.subtitle: Physical Activity in Contemporary Society.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The study of the structure of the human body with special emphasis on the musculoskeletal, articular, and nervous systems. Prosected cadaver materials are utilized to study the skeletal muscles and body viscera.Gen Ed: PL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS180
classes.subtitle: Physical Activity in Contemporary Society.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An examination of the role of physical activity/inactivity on the health and well-being of American society.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS181
classes.subtitle: Sport and Exercise Psychology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An examination of the role of physical activity/inactivity on the health and well-being of American society.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS181
classes.subtitle: Sport and Exercise Psychology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course exposes students to psychological aspects contributing to sport/physical activity participation and psychological outcomes of participation. It explores psychological theories and research and their application to the affective, behavioral, and cognitive outcomes of sport/physical activity participants when considering key environmental factors.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS191
classes.subtitle: Theory and Practice of Modern Dance Technique - Elementary-Level Elective.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course exposes students to psychological aspects contributing to sport/physical activity participation and psychological outcomes of participation. It explores psychological theories and research and their application to the affective, behavioral, and cognitive outcomes of sport/physical activity participants when considering key environmental factors.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS191
classes.subtitle: Theory and Practice of Modern Dance Technique - Elementary-Level Elective.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern dance technique, history, and philosophy focusing on the physical principles of movement and their choreographic application. Students will participate in a combination of lectures and studio time.Gen Ed: VP.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS205
classes.subtitle: Analysis of Sport Skills I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern dance technique, history, and philosophy focusing on the physical principles of movement and their choreographic application. Students will participate in a combination of lectures and studio time.Gen Ed: VP.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS205
classes.subtitle: Analysis of Sport Skills I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A professional preparation course in the skills, knowledge, safety, and teaching progressions of basketball, track and field, and softball/baseball.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS206
classes.subtitle: Analysis of Sport Skills II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A professional preparation course in the skills, knowledge, safety, and teaching progressions of basketball, track and field, and softball/baseball.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS206
classes.subtitle: Analysis of Sport Skills II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A professional preparation course in the skills, knowledge, safety, and teaching progressions of soccer, tennis, and volleyball.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS207
classes.subtitle: Coaching Principles.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A professional preparation course in the skills, knowledge, safety, and teaching progressions of soccer, tennis, and volleyball.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS207
classes.subtitle: Coaching Principles.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A professional preparation course for teaching and coaching. Includes basic instruction in coaching education and principles, pedagogy for coaching, conditioning for athletes, and team building.Gen Ed: EE- Field Work.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS208
classes.subtitle: Health and Physical Education in the Elementary School.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A professional preparation course for teaching and coaching. Includes basic instruction in coaching education and principles, pedagogy for coaching, conditioning for athletes, and team building.Gen Ed: EE- Field Work.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS208
classes.subtitle: Health and Physical Education in the Elementary School.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course deals with methods and materials of health and physical education in school levels kindergarten through sixth grade. Required of elementary education majors. Does not count toward physical education major.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS211
classes.subtitle: Adapted Physical Education.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course deals with methods and materials of health and physical education in school levels kindergarten through sixth grade. Required of elementary education majors. Does not count toward physical education major.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS211
classes.subtitle: Adapted Physical Education.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A study of problems related to body mechanics and the needs of the physically handicapped student.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS220
classes.subtitle: Fitness Management.  3 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS220

classes.title: EXSS221
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Sport Administration.  3 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS221

classes.title: EXSS223

classes.description: Recommended preparation, EXSS�221.  This course provides a foundation in general legal concepts and familiarizes students with the legal areas they are most likely to encounter as managers in the sports and fitness industry.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.subtitle: Predictive Analytics in Sports.  3 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS397

classes.title: EXSS397
classes.subtitle: Critical Analysis of Literature in Sport and Exercise Psychology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will expose students to research in sport and exercise psychology using the C.R.E.A.T.E. (Consider, Read, Elucidate the hypotheses, Analyze and interpret the data, and Think of the next Experiment) framework. Students will follow the historical publications of one sport and exercise psychology research group to better understand the research process. Each research paper will be digested/critiqued in phases. Student will also formulate their own novel research questions and present them to the class.Requisites: Prerequisite, EXSS�181.Grading status: Letter grade.

Each research paper will be digested/critiqued in phases. Student will also formulate their own novel research questions and present them to the class.Requisites: Prerequisite, EXSS�181.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.subtitle: Theory and Application of Strength Training and Conditioning for Fitness Professionals.  3 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS410
classes.subtitle: Exercise Testing and Prescription.  4 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS420
classes.subtitle: Program Planning in Recreation Services.  3 Credits.

Students apply their program planning skills to real-life situations and implement a recreation program for a community agency. classes.subtitle: Introduction to Leadership and Group Dynamics.  3 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS430
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Leadership and Group Dynamics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An analysis of the techniques, methods, and motives of group and community leaders. classes.title: EXSS450
classes.subtitle: Essentials of Corrective Exercise Training.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An analysis of the techniques, methods, and motives of group and community leaders. classes.title: EXSS450
classes.subtitle: Essentials of Corrective Exercise Training.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course provides students with knowledge and experience in designing corrective exercise programs. Students will learn to assess posture, movement quality, range of motion, and strength. Students will also learn to correct abnormalities exercises for various body parts. Knowledge will be gained via lecture and laboratory activities. Previously offered as EXSS 350.Requisites: Prerequisites, EXSS�175 and 276.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS475
classes.subtitle: Functional Anatomy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course provides students with knowledge and experience in designing corrective exercise programs. Students will learn to assess posture, movement quality, range of motion, and strength. Students will also learn to correct abnormalities exercises for various body parts. Knowledge will be gained via lecture and laboratory activities. Previously offered as EXSS 350.Requisites: Prerequisites, EXSS�175 and 276.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS475
classes.subtitle: Functional Anatomy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of joint mechanics. It exposes students to motions of the cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine as well as the extremities, and relates these concepts to movement of the body during specific activities.Requisites: Prerequisites,  EXSS�175, 276, and 385.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS493

classes.description: This field experience offers implementation of theory and the practical application of sport administration in a sport organization worksite, under the direct supervision of a business professional.Requisites: Prerequisites, EXSS�221 and at least two of the following: EXSS�322, 323, 324, 326; permission of the instructor required for students lacking the prerequisites.Gen Ed: EE- Academic Internship.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS576
classes.subtitle: Exercise Endocrinology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This field experience offers implementation of theory and the practical application of sport administration in a sport organization worksite, under the direct supervision of a business professional.Requisites: Prerequisites, EXSS�221 and at least two of the following: EXSS�322, 323, 324, 326; permission of the instructor required for students lacking the prerequisites.Gen Ed: EE- Academic Internship.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS576
classes.subtitle: Exercise Endocrinology.  3 Credits.

classes.title: EXSS580
classes.subtitle: Neuromechanics of Human Movement.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Advanced course examining the responses of the endocrine system to exercise and the adaptations that occur with exercise training. Provides the fundamentals necessary for exercise science and allied health science students to understand the integral role that the endocrine system plays in exercise.Requisites: Prerequisites, EXSS�175, 276, and 376.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS580
classes.subtitle: Neuromechanics of Human Movement.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course explores interactions between the nervous and musculoskeletal systems via integration of concepts from neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, anatomy, neuromuscular control, and biomechanics. Topics include muscle mechanics, sensorimotor function, joint stability, movement disorders, neurocognition, and neuroplasticity following injury and disease. Course meetings involve both lecture and laboratory content.Requisites: Prerequisites, EXSS�175, 380, and 385.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS700
classes.subtitle: Applied Statistics and Research Methods in Exercise and Sport Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, a cumulative grade point average meeting the University standard and permission of the department. Preparation of an honors thesis and an oral examination on the thesis.Requisites: Prerequisite, EXSS�273.Gen Ed: EE- Mentored Research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS700
classes.subtitle: Applied Statistics and Research Methods in Exercise and Sport Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, undergraduate statistics course. Applied statistical analysis - interpretation of data from exercise and sport science. Emphasis: choosing method of analysis, using statistics software to run analyses. Major topics: experimental and nonexperimental research design, sampling, hypothesis testing, power calculation, t-tests, ANOVA, correlation, simple and multiple regression, and chi square.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS705
classes.subtitle: Applied Statistics and Research Methods Laboratory.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, undergraduate statistics course. Applied statistical analysis - interpretation of data from exercise and sport science. Emphasis: choosing method of analysis, using statistics software to run analyses. Major topics: experimental and nonexperimental research design, sampling, hypothesis testing, power calculation, t-tests, ANOVA, correlation, simple and multiple regression, and chi square.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS705
classes.subtitle: Applied Statistics and Research Methods Laboratory.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, any undergraduate statistics course. Builds heavily upon material presented in EXSS�700. Planning, conducting, and reporting of research. Thesis writing and writing for publication. Problem-solving and practical experience in applied statistical analysis, interpretation, and presentation of data from the field of exercise and sport science.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS730
classes.subtitle: Management of Athletic Injuries.  3 Credits.

classes.subtitle: Management of Athletic Injuries.  3 Credits.

classes.description: Permission of the instructor for nonmajors. Designed to provide basic knowledge and skills that aid in the prevention and treatment of injuries common to athletics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EXSS732
classes.subtitle: Human Anatomy for Athletic Trainers.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Graduate standing in exercise and sport science or permission of the instructor. The study of gross human anatomy, with emphasis on the functional and clinical aspects of the neck, back, and extremities as related to athletic injuries.Grading status: Letter grade.
